Downloaded https://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.6/Python-2.7.6.tgz
MD5 checksum:
1d8728eb0dfcac72a0fd99c17ec7f386  14725931  Python-2.7.6.tgz

From the web page http://www.python.org/download/releases/2.7.6/

    Python 2.7.6 was released on November 10, 2013.
    This is a 2.7 series bugfix release. 
    This is a production release.

    The Python 2.7 series is scheduled to be the last major version in the 2.x
    series before 2.x moves into an extended maintenance period.  The 2.7 series
    contains many of the features that were first released in Python 3.1. 
    Improvements in this release include:
    + An ordered dictionary type
    + New unittest features including test skipping, new assert methods, and test discovery
    + A much faster io module
    + Automatic numbering of fields in the str.format() method
    + Float repr improvements backported from 3.x
    + Tile support for Tkinter
    + A backport of the memoryview object from 3.x
    + Set literals
    + Set and dictionary comprehensions
    + Dictionary views
    + New syntax for nested with statements
    + The sysconfig module


License-----
See the file "License-Python-2.7.6.txt".  It has the license from
the page http://docs.python.org/license.html
That page also has this note:
  All Python licenses, unlike the GPL, let you distribute a modified version
  without making your changes open source. The GPL-compatible licenses make it
  possible to combine Python with other software that is released under the GPL;
  the others don't.
